questions.description: The prime area of neuron system where different types of informations are integrated:
Depolarisation of neural membranes is caused due to:
A chemical synapse is formed by:

options.description: Only presynaptic membrane and synaptic knob
Connection through gap junctions between presynaptic knob and postsynaptic membrane
Presynaptic membrane, synaptic cleft and postsynaptic membrane

questions.description: During the resting state of a nerve fibre, the axonal membrane is:

options.description: More permeable of K⁺ than Na⁺
More permeable to Na⁺ than K⁺
Equally permeable to Na⁺ and K⁺
More permeable to Cl¯ and Na⁺

questions.description: Branched fibrous structures projecting out of the cell body that show presence of Nissl's granules are called?
Which among the following has the simplest neural network?
In which phylum, neural organisation is observed for the first time?
Major part of peripheral nervous system is somatic neural system which relays impulses from CNS to:
Pseudounipolar neurons occur in:

options.description: Dorsal root ganglion of spinal cord

questions.description: Which statement is correct about nerve fibres?

options.description: All nerve fibres of CNS are enclosed by Schwann cells
Only myelinated nerve fibres of PNS are enclosed by Schwann cells
All nerve fibres of PNS are enclosed by Schwann cells
Only myelinated fibres of CNS are enclosed by Schwann cells

questions.description: The (A) neuron receives signals from sensory organ and transmit the impulse via (B) nerve root into the CNS:
At least how many afferent and efferent neurons are involved in any reflex action?

options.description: One afferent, two efferent, one interneuron
One afferent, one efferent, two interneuron
Two efferent, one efferent, one interneuron

questions.description: Nerve cells possess: (a) Dendrites (b) Axon (c) Sarcolemma (d) Neurilemma

Read the following statement: (A) Peripheral nervous system divides in somatic nervous system & autonomic nervous system (B) Central nervous system includes brain & vertebral column (C) Afferent nerve fibre transmit impulse from CNS and vise versa is also correct How many of above statements is/are false?

In human, autonomic nervous system is composed of:
All spinal nerves are:
You are watching a horror movie and you notice your heart is beating fast and mouth is dry. It is because of:
Which system provides an organised network of point to point connection?
Where A stands for axon, D for dendrite, S for synapse, and CB for cell body, a typical sequence of structures between a receptor and an efferent is?

options.description: D – CB – A – S – D – CB – A
A – D – CB – S – A – D – CB
D – CB – A – S – A – CB – D
D – A – S – CB – D – A – CB

questions.description: In a resting membrane, potassium diffuses from:

options.description: Extracellular fluid to intracellular fluid through diffusion ion channels
Extracellular fluid to intracellular fluid through voltage gated sodium ion channel

questions.description: The change in membrane potential from –70 mV to –90 mV is represented as:
Which of the following best describes the state of a neuron at rest?

options.description: K⁺ ions leak into the neuron at rest
The inside and outside of a neuron have the same electrical charge
The outside of a neuron is more negatively charged than the inside
The inside of a neuron is more negatively charged than the outside

questions.description: Factor responsible for the depolarisation of the neuron is:

options.description: Opening of voltage gated K⁺ channel
Opening of voltage gated Na⁺ channel
Closure of voltage gated K⁺ channel
Closure of voltage gated Na⁺ channel

questions.description: If the inside of the membrane becomes more negative than the resting membrane potential it leads to:

Study the diagram of synapse: I. Which alphabet indicates the location of the receptor molecules? II. Which alphabet points to synaptic vesicles? III. Which alphabet points to neurotransmitter? IV. Which alphabet points to synaptic cleft?

Five events in the transmission of nerve impulse across the synapse are given below: A. Opening of specific ion channels allows the entry of ions, a new action potential is generated in the post-synaptic neuron B. Neurotransmitter binds to the receptor on post synaptic membrane C. Synaptic vesicle fuses with pre-synaptic membrane, neurotransmitter releases into synaptic cleft D. Depolarisation of pre-synaptic membrane E. Arrival of action potential at axon terminal In which sequence to the events occur?
Which of the statement is false regarding synapse?

options.description: Synapse is formed by two membrane first presynaptic membrane of synaptic knob & second post synaptic membrane of dendrite
Synaptic membrane always be separated by a gap called synaptic cleft
Electrical synapse is very similar to impulse conduction along a single axon
In chemical synapse, neurotransmitter is released and either excitatory or inhibitory potential is generated on post synaptic membrane

questions.description: Which of the following statement is correct? (A) The electrical potential difference across the polarised plasma membrane is called as action potential in resting stage (B) Na+ ion is responsible for generating an action potential (C) The impulse is action potential
"Jumping of the action potential" at the nodes of ranvier is known as:
The main function of acetylcholine is to:

options.description: Help in synaptic transmission of nerve impulse
Help in conduction of nerve impulse through axon

questions.description: Unidirectional transmission of a nerve impulse through synapse fibre is due to:

options.description: Nerve fibre is insulated by a medullary sheath
Sodium pump starts operating only at the cyton and then continues into the nerve fibre
Neurotransmitters are released by dendrites and not by axon endings
Neurotransmitters are released by the axon endings and not by dendrites

options.description: Lens, aqueous humor and vitreous humor
